course_title: Doing Deals: Employee Compensation and Benefits
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 12Waitlist Total: 0 of 3
class_notes: Registration for this class is only for students in the Transactional Certificate Program. Non-certificate students can try to enroll during Open Enrollment, if there are open seats.
course_description: Students in this course will study the key types and design of compensation and employee benefits arrangements provided to employees by private employers and the key federal laws governing those arrangements, particularly the United States Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, but also federal securities, labor and employment laws. Through the lens of M&A, this course will examine various executive compensation and employee benefits.
sections: Class Nbr: 2912, Section #: 001, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 10:30a-1:30p, Instructor: I. Levin, Status: Open
